posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
You caught me heading out but here is build I set up for HotU and other 30 max environments.  I used wizard levels to increase the number of Darkness casts since the synergy of Wiz/Asn is so sweet.  I noticed that the wiz levels would need to be rearranged for Arelith but this happens to be a STR build.  A DEX version would not be hard to do if you are not fussy about damage per round.  Kamas and fists can both be finessed but that requires another feat.  Check it out and reply so we can better learn your preferences without lots of iterations.  You'd need to swap fighter for wizard for duel-wielding kamas but fists don't need that.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
No magic, eh? Okie doke.  This one does have summoning capabilities but just ignore those if you prefer.

A build based on your "evil" theme.  This is a high-damage STR version. You can go DEX but without either Uncanny Dodge or Defensive Awareness, the AC total, although looking good on paper, is always in jeopardy.  To be capable of epic taunting, you'll need to sacrifice something because Mnk16/BG5/Ftr9 or Mnk16/BG6/Ftr8 loses a feat and its already a human.  But perhaps losing an intrinsic AB is worth it to reach another 6 AB from a successful taunt (figure 39 AB in that case).  Just watch out for pallies.  They will take your ethical choice seriously and try to smite your butt.

Move the feats around as you prefer.  It's only the list itself that concerned me.  Why Disarm/ImpDisarm?  Fists always match the opposed weapon size.  But choose whatever floats your boat for those 2 feats.  Maybe Called Shot and Imp Expertise (although your AB isn't all that lofty to hit much at -10). It's a pick 'em IMO.

Stock up on Eagle pots.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I like the way you got both Uncanny Dodge and Epic Dodge in there.  Unfortunately, IIRC on Arelith, HiPS just gives bonuses to the stealth skills and damage will be hard-pressed to keep up with the opposed attack.  But ED will go a long way towards standing in there when things get dire.  Flankers are still an issue even with Uncanny Dodge.  8 AC is a lot to lose when mobbed.

The only way I know to compensate for a "rich" WIS investment is with cleric buffs.  There we get high AC, high AB and high damage even without investing heavily into STR.  Alas, divine boosts are not part of the equation of this request.

Kinda hard to compare builds when the gifts get thrown into the mix.  I'd probably choose CON, DEX and CHA in the BG version.  We get three of them?
